The emergency stop is a red mushroom button under a flip cover—slap-ready. (pause)
You can slap it without thinking—if you’ll spend a year defending the slap. (pause)
A tag dangles: SEALED — USE REQUIRES POST-ACTION AUTHORIZATION. (pause)
A placard answers like it’s been in court before: (pause)
EMERGENCY STOP INITIATES CONTROLLED DECELERATION SEQUENCE WHERE PRACTICABLE. (pause)
Then smaller: PRACTICABLE IS DETERMINED RETROACTIVELY.

You lift the cover. (pause)
The hinge squeaks, and it feels like a witness. (pause)
Under the button, another label: DO NOT USE TO SIMPLIFY PROCEDURE. (pause)
That one is new. (pause)
You don’t press it. (pause)
Even standing here you can hear the memo being drafted about what you “intended.”
